message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.DC 

This paper deals with the problem of utilizing device-to-device (D2D) connections among mobile devices to meet the increasing throughput demand over cellular links. This problem is related to networking and information theory, which are covered by the cs.NI and cs.IT sub-categories. The paper also proposes a network coding framework for cooperative mobile devices, which involves system-level optimization and control, and can be categorized under the cs.SY sub-category. Additionally, the paper uses simulations to demonstrate the benefits of the proposed framework, which involves multimedia and computer graphics, and can be categorized under the cs.MM sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with the joint cellular and D2D networking system, which involves distributed computing and can be categorized under the cs.DC sub-category.
